alert.note: Alert for South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued November 23 at 6:39AM PST until November 24 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM PST FRIDAY... ...FROST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM PST FRIDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 30 expected. For the Frost Advisory, temperatures as low as 33 will result in frost formation. For the Freeze Watch, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 29 possible. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Coast in Coos County. For the Frost Advisory, this includes Coos Bay and Sixes. The Freeze Warning includes Myrtle Point and Powers. For the Freeze Watch, this includes Coquille, Myrtle Point, Coos Bay, and Powers. * WHEN...For the Freeze Warning, from 2 AM to 9 AM PST Friday. For the Freeze Watch, from late Friday night through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
